intro: Vasconcellea microcarpa subsp. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited wax plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a waxy appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
